summary:
Partner+Team Request from @bisexualvulpix I’d absolutely love to hear what you think my team/partner would be!! :D
 My name’s...
body:
Partner+Team Request from @bisexualvulpix

I’d absolutely love to hear what you think my team/partner would be!! :D

My name’s Nicole, I’m 20 years old, cis female, panromantic asexual. I have depression, social anxiety, OCD, and BPD, so I’m constantly working on my mental health. Despite all of that, I’m a very positive, upbeat person. I’m an Aries (born March 27th), my favorite animals are horses, my favorite color is blue, and my MBTI personality type is ISFJ (“the defender”). I love the water; going swimming is a lot of fun to me, and I love spending time at the beach! I’m incredibly loyal to my friends, but I also have a tendency to be insecure and even jealous. My hobbies include reading, roleplaying, watching YouTube, and playing video games. I’m working a summer job as a cashier at WalMart but in the fall I’m going into my fourth year studying forensic anthropology, which is my passion in life! I also have a cat and a dog, both of whom I love very much! I’m an animal lover in general, really, and I absolutely adore the Pokemon games. My favorite TV show is Firefly, my favorite movies are RENT and Sweeney Todd (I love musicals), and my favorite book is Watership Down by Richard Adams. I can’t really think of anything else to say about me, but feel free to read up on my social media (mentioned below) to learn more!

My instagram is nicolelikespigeons and my Tumblr is bisexualvulpix!

Hello Nicole! I think I got a cool team for you~

Your Partner is…

Golduck!

♡ Golduck is a great swimmer! It has high endurance in water, and can out swim any human. Not even a rough, stormy sea is intimidating to this Pokemon. They have been known to rescue swimming Pokemon & People alike. It will love to do any water activities with you, and it also is very comfortable walking on land. So it will be just as home in your house, watching TV & musicals together!

♡ Although not a psychic type, it does display many psychic qualities. It’s gem is thought to be an amplifier of it’s power. It has also been known to be able to communicate telepathically with other Pokemon & even humans! This intelligent Pokemon will be a great friend through tough times, and is valued as a support Pokemon. 

♡ Intelligent, somewhat psychic & telepathic, this Pokemon would do a good job working by your side in forensics. It can probe into the the minds of people & communicate without speech. This Pokemon would be keenly intuitive & aware of what’s going on. It could be great help in many scenarios! 

Other team members include:


Hope you like your team decently! ^~^

(Vulpix was going to be on the team, since I see you like it a lot! But I tried not to be so obvious. It’s your secret 7th team member, though C:)

blog.name: attitxde
blog.title: Fuel is pumping engines, burning hard, loose and clean!
blog.description:
Give me fuel, give me fire, and quench my thirst with gasoline!

Indie HG/SS games verse Rocket Executive Archer. Selective, multi ship and multiverse. This blog is very canon and fanon divergent.

Established March 29th, 2015 and moved blogs June 9th, 2017. Always semi-active.

Please read the rules, bio, and info pages before interacting. Links are the paw prints below the post section.

Theme art was done by erlenwald.
Backgrounds are from here and here.

Tracking attitxde.
OOC tag is out of attitude.
Queue tag is normal life makes me delirious.

summary: Have you ever wanted to create a Delta type pokemon or new region variant like Alola forms, but couldn’t come up with anything?...
body:
Have you ever wanted to create a Delta type pokemon or new region variant like Alola forms, but couldn’t come up with anything? I’ve got you covered!

Here’s a random generator with every pokemon and ultra beasts!

Single type is -right here- and dual type is -right here-.

Feel free to reblog this so other people can get cool ideas as well.

If you draw anything the generator gives you please feel free to put a link in my submissions, tag me, or send me a link via IMs, and I’ll reblog it!

title: Relicanth - 369
body:
It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea expedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now survives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.

- Pokemon Moon

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Karrablast and Escavalier
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Karrablast and Escavalier
body:
588: Karrablast

Here’s a weird addition. Karrablast is a pretty weird looking bug. Looking like a bug in silhouette alone more than with its actual appearance. Otherwise, it looks like a weird goblin dressed up as a bug. If it weren’t for its interaction with another Pokemon, people would be hard-pressed and making all kinds of theories about what bug Karrablast would accurately be based on.

We won’t get to talking about it for some time (because for whatever reason, these two lines aren’t next to each other in Pokedex order), but it’s important to these two so here it is anyway. This is Shelmet, a fellow Bug type snail Pokemon wearing an armored shell. Cute right?

Well, this inspiration turns gruesome with the inspiration of these two Pokemon species. Karrablast is now quite clearly a Carabid Beetle, particularly a species that preys on snails and makes a meal by emptying out their shells. Karrablast is significantly less dark though. It does come with an interesting evolution method where it and Shelmet will only evolve if they’re traded with each other. The end result of the trade is that Karrablast forces Shelmet out of its shell, and then decides to wear the shell instead, evolving into Escavalier while a now-shelless Shelmet evolves into something else as well.

Personal Score: 7/10

Bonus points for just being neat, if a little bit plain of a bug monster.

589: Escavalier

That’s where Escavalier comes in. Only by stealing the metal shell of Shelmet will Karrablast evolve into the knight-looking snail-shelled jousting beetle. Which is such an absurd direction to take this inspiration of creature, especially considering how a Carabid Beetle is an otherwise pretty standard-looking insect. An amount of weirdness that perhaps intrudes on the design a bit since its very body shape looks rather impractical, but I love the presence it gives anyway. So weird, but also so damn cool and ferocious looking.

Whatever the case may be, this is one of those Pokemon I never realized I wanted until I first laid eyes on the leaks, and saw some badass jousting knight of a Bug Type amongst some standard-looking mammal and fungi Pokemon. The one thing I could nitpick about it is that the design doesn’t make a whole lot of sense, given it has no legs and no obvious way of being able to move. Other than just assuming it floats. I can’t gripe on that too hard. It’s far from the first Pokemon that floats solely because it’s more convenient for the design that way. But that said, I think it could’ve easily gotten away with a pair of wings. Not huge wings, but it’d be enough to further get the point across that this creature may look like a snail, but isn’t actually a snail.

Personal Score: 9.5/10

Overall:

A neat Pokemon with some cool interactions going on with its counterpart. In any case, it’s too cool a design to say no to.

[Archive]

Personal Score: 7/10

Bonus points for just being neat, if a little bit plain of a bug monster.

589: Escavalier

That’s where Escavalier comes in. Only by stealing the metal shell of Shelmet will Karrablast evolve into the knight-looking snail-shelled jousting beetle. Which is such an absurd direction to take this inspiration of creature, especially considering how a Carabid Beetle is an otherwise pretty standard-looking insect. An amount of weirdness that perhaps intrudes on the design a bit since its very body shape looks rather impractical, but I love the presence it gives anyway. So weird, but also so damn cool and ferocious looking.

Whatever the case may be, this is one of those Pokemon I never realized I wanted until I first laid eyes on the leaks, and saw some badass jousting knight of a Bug Type amongst some standard-looking mammal and fungi Pokemon. The one thing I could nitpick about it is that the design doesn’t make a whole lot of sense, given it has no legs and no obvious way of being able to move. Other than just assuming it floats. I can’t gripe on that too hard. It’s far from the first Pokemon that floats solely because it’s more convenient for the design that way. But that said, I think it could’ve easily gotten away with a pair of wings. Not huge wings, but it’d be enough to further get the point across that this creature may look like a snail, but isn’t actually a snail.

Personal Score: 9.5/10

Overall:

A neat Pokemon with some cool interactions going on with its counterpart. In any case, it’s too cool a design to say no to.

[Archive]
trail.content:
588: Karrablast

Here’s a weird addition. Karrablast is a pretty weird looking bug. Looking like a bug in silhouette alone more than with its actual appearance. Otherwise, it looks like a weird goblin dressed up as a bug. If it weren’t for its interaction with another Pokemon, people would be hard-pressed and making all kinds of theories about what bug Karrablast would accurately be based on.

We won’t get to talking about it for some time (because for whatever reason, these two lines aren’t next to each other in Pokedex order), but it’s important to these two so here it is anyway. This is Shelmet, a fellow Bug type snail Pokemon wearing an armored shell. Cute right?

Well, this inspiration turns gruesome with the inspiration of these two Pokemon species. Karrablast is now quite clearly a Carabid Beetle, particularly a species that preys on snails and makes a meal by emptying out their shells. Karrablast is significantly less dark though. It does come with an interesting evolution method where it and Shelmet will only evolve if they’re traded with each other. The end result of the trade is that Karrablast forces Shelmet out of its shell, and then decides to wear the shell instead, evolving into Escavalier while a now-shelless Shelmet evolves into something else as well.

Personal Score: 7/10

Bonus points for just being neat, if a little bit plain of a bug monster.

589: Escavalier

That’s where Escavalier comes in. Only by stealing the metal shell of Shelmet will Karrablast evolve into the knight-looking snail-shelled jousting beetle. Which is such an absurd direction to take this inspiration of creature, especially considering how a Carabid Beetle is an otherwise pretty standard-looking insect. An amount of weirdness that perhaps intrudes on the design a bit since its very body shape looks rather impractical, but I love the presence it gives anyway. So weird, but also so damn cool and ferocious looking.

Whatever the case may be, this is one of those Pokemon I never realized I wanted until I first laid eyes on the leaks, and saw some badass jousting knight of a Bug Type amongst some standard-looking mammal and fungi Pokemon. The one thing I could nitpick about it is that the design doesn’t make a whole lot of sense, given it has no legs and no obvious way of being able to move. Other than just assuming it floats. I can’t gripe on that too hard. It’s far from the first Pokemon that floats solely because it’s more convenient for the design that way. But that said, I think it could’ve easily gotten away with a pair of wings. Not huge wings, but it’d be enough to further get the point across that this creature may look like a snail, but isn’t actually a snail.

Personal Score: 9.5/10

Overall:

A neat Pokemon with some cool interactions going on with its counterpart. In any case, it’s too cool a design to say no to.

[Archive]

summary: If nearly every jp game recently is just gonna be a dinosaur battle sim, they should just make a Pokémon-esque rpg game. Or a...
body:
If nearly every jp game recently is just gonna be a dinosaur battle sim, they should just make a Pokémon-esque rpg game. Or a straight up fighter.


I mean Alive is already a Go! Clone so…
